article.title: How does a locally constrained quantum system localize?

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the color gradient in Figure 1 represent?
choices: Strength of the transverse field disorder (Wx)
Strength of the longitudinal field disorder (Wz)

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 2, what does the peak near -1 in panel (a) indicate about the diagonal MBL phase?
choices: Spins in this phase tend to align with their local z-field.
The system is highly entangled in this phase.
Thermalization occurs rapidly in this phase.
The system exhibits critical behavior in this phase.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3 investigates the behavior of the system at Wz = 0. What trend do both panels (a) and (b) consistently show for gx/Wx > 1 as N increases?
choices: The system transitions into a localized phase.
The system approaches thermal values, indicating a thermal phase.
The system remains in the diagonal MBL phase.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Formula (5), what does the parameter δω control in the Strong-Strong-Weak (SSW) model?
choices: The strength of the disorder on all sites
The strength of the x-field on sites i = 0 mod 3
The strength of the z-field on all sites
The energy difference between adjacent spins
